activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Meghan E. McCann

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on November 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

1:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Noah M Tylenda and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Meghan E. McCann appeared by phone.  Attorney Joseph Michael Freier appeared by video for Meghan E. McCann. Defendants Attorney stands mute, Court enters a not guilty plea. Matter to be set. Bond continued.

records.addlTxt: 10:35 AM Defendant Meghan E. McCann in court.  Emmeline Lee appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court appoints attorney Joseph Freier; defendant to repay at $50 per month. Continue as set.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

1:51 PM Defendant Meghan E. McCann in court by audio.  Noah M Tylenda appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions. No contact with any Festival Foods in Rock County. No consumption of any medication except in prescribed amount. Defendant must sign bond on June 14, 2022 between 12 PM and 1 PM. Indigency hearing scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 10:30 AM. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
